intro: Lepechinia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico, particularly in the state of Oaxaca. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
